title: Technology-Integrated Mathematics Project-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics education experience, basic digital tool utilization skills
context.additional_context: A process for in-service elementary teachers to acquire methods of effectively integrating technology into mathematics instruction through project-based activities, provided in a fully equipped digital environment (tablets, interactive whiteboards, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners will be able to design three or more interactive lesson materials using digital tools suitable for explaining mathematical concepts (e.g., GeoGebra, Desmos).
Learners will develop a lesson scenario that improves learner engagement by 20% or more by planning technology-based math projects (e.g., measurement/geometry domains) using the PBL approach.
Learners will be able to observe peer teachers' technology-integrated lessons and provide five or more improvement feedbacks using a formative assessment rubric.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
